channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic Lights have been out of order for several days, 10th November
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights have been out of order all week. It is very dangerous to cross here. This morning there were five cyclists queued up waiting to cross this very busy road. Eventually one cyclist had to cycle into the flow of traffic to force it to slow down. Please sort these out before there is a fatality.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Payment covered with sand and dirt after city fibre works, 10th November
item.description:
Payment covered with sand and dirt after city fibre works. Can someone else them to come and sweep up please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62/66 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham

item.title: Pavement outside Coronation Square shops including farm foods and Greggs covered with leaves and litter, 10th November
item.description:
Pavement outside Coronation Square shops including farm foods and Greggs covered with leaves and litter. Not sure whose job it is to tidy up the leaves but this is a high football area and really need something done

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62/66 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham

item.title: 50 mph road signs between jct 10 and jct 9 northbound, 9th November
item.description:
These signs are generally been ignored, and therefore it feels unsafe when lorries and other vehicles speed past at 70MPH Should those signs still be there and why are drivers ignoring them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Elmstone Hardwicke

item.title: Group of potholes - Inside lane, 9th November
item.description:
M5 Northbound between J12 and J11 A about 200 yards before sign M5B 90.1 about 2 miles before turn off for J11A. Inside lane There are many potholes on inside lane - on stretch J12 to J11A - dangerous for motorbikes and getting much worse recently
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote

item.title: Dense wet leaves on path, 7th November
item.description:

item.title: Leaning telegraph poles, 6th November
item.description:
Both of these telephone poles are leaning quite considerably and can be wobbled just by leaning on them. Residents have raised fears of them falling over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 86 Henley Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Dangerously loose paving stones outside F.Hinds lower High Street, 5th November
item.description:
A pedestrian fell after slipping on loose paving stones with a precipitous incline, probably about two inches of moving vertical space. Please could the loose stones be set safely back in place? Thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 229 High Street, Cheltenham

item.title: No lighting at all at the roundabout and crossing., 4th November
item.description:
There is currently no lighting on the roundabout or the dangerous crossing just off of the roundabout. I have nearly witnessed 3 road traffic accidents due to it being so dark up there. Colleagues of mine have also expressed how hard it is to judge the oncoming traffic and car signals due to the darkness around the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Birdlip
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Totally unnecessary traffic lights, 5th November
item.description:
Why does Greenways have traffic lights? This just adds to more drivers stopping and more time wasted and more pollution. The few drivers who use this can surely wait a few extra seconds? Public finances are limited enough yet here we have a significant sum of money spent on turnings, markings and traffic lights for a single road with only a few houses. There are no traffic lights along this road for Barnwood Avenue, Chosen Way, Larkhay Road, Brookfield Road, Porchester Road. As a taxpayer I’d like to know how this expenditure and resource putting this in is justified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Barnwood Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights out, 4th November
item.description:
